qas.question: What is produced on a computer display when light from the green primary is mixed with some light from the blue primary?
At what wavelength is green on computer displays?
What type of color devices are computer displays and televisions?
What is the wavelength of red?

plausible_answers.text: mixing light from the green primary with some light from the blue primary

qas.question: How is a unique blue made?
What are examples of devices that do not use additive systems?

plausible_answers.text: an orangish-red "red" primary and a purplish-blue "blue" primary

qas.question: ~550nm green is a combination of which two primary colours?

context: In <a2_0>additive<a2_0/> color devices such as <b5_0>computer displays and televisions<b5_0/>, one of the primary light sources is typically a narrow-spectrum yellowish-green of dominant wavelength <a1_0><b3_0><b6_0>~550 nm<b6_0/><b3_0/><a1_0/>; this "green" primary is combined with <b7_0>an orangish-red "red" primary and a purplish-blue "blue" primary<b7_0/> to produce any color in between – the RGB color model. <a0_0>A unique green<a0_0/> (green appearing neither yellowish nor bluish) is produced on such a device by <b4_0>mixing light from the green primary with some light from the blue primary<b4_0/>.
